title: Mozilla Firefox browser not working properly getting error when trying to open or relaunch
content:
Hi Team,

Please help Mozilla Firefox browser is not opening .when tried to uninstall and install the browser it is showing error message like "The code execution cannot proceed because dbghelp.dll was not found.Reinstalling the program may fix this problem.".

Uninstalled browser and installed.when trying to open the browser getting this help.Even google chrome browser , microsoft EDGE browser also not opening.

Only Internet Explorer is opening.please help me to resolve this issue.

Any suggestions or help will welcome.

Regards,

Vineela
creator: vineelavinni0507

title: vk.com does not work without enabling the private window
content: It gives an error about the mismatch of the password and username only when I try to access the site through the standard browser mode. in private mode or other browsers, everything works fine. I was deleting the browser. Turned off the extensions. I was cleaning the cache. it didn't help.
creator: berhram

title: Restore tabs from previous session when restarting FF.
content:
For years I've had multiple open tabs and pinned tabs while browsing, then when I quit and restarted FF all of the tabs reopened when I restarted.

I've recently upgraded to a newer MacBook Pro and now FF is not reopening tabs upon restart. I also didn't need to login to FF each time I started it on my old computer, but FF on the new computer makes me login every time I restart. I'm using version 88.0.1 on the new computer and 88.0 on the previous computer. I have followed the instructions from the article below, and I've even uninstalled and reinstalled FF, but nothing has worked:

[Restore Previous Session]

I'm terribly frustrated and I would be ever so appreciative if anyone can help me figure this out! Thank you!
creator: lsinger3

title: Quick searches re-enables itself randomly after being turned off
content:
It's all in the title. The "quick searches" feature that pops up when I highlight text is a lot more annoying then useful, so I turned it off... and it seems to re-enable itself randomly. One time I disabled it, and after 5 seconds, it re-enabled itself. So annoying. I've made so many accidental searches with that stupid feature. I mean, how many people copy text just to search it up? Even then, they can highlight the text, right click, then click "Search (engline) for (text)".

The point being, the feature is re-enabling itself randomly, and it's getting on my nerves.

I don't see any option within the settings to turn it off. Any ideas?

Thanks, 

    Stephen
creator: skcroushore
